FuncDef:
The frr command creates an OSPFv3 FRR view and enters the OSPFv3 FRR view.
The undo frr command exits from the OSPFv3 FRR view and deletes the OSPFv3 FRR view. The frr command creates an OSPFv3 FRR view and enters the OSPFv3 FRR view. The undo frr command exits from the OSPFv3 FRR view and deletes the OSPFv3 FRR view. By default, no OSPFv3 FRR view is created. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: OSPFv3 IP FRR needs to be configured in the OSPFv3 FRR view. To create an OSPFv3 FRR view and enter the OSPFv3 FRR view, run the frr command. To enable OSPFv3 IP FRR, run the loop-free-alternate command in the OSPFv3 FRR view so that a loop-free backup link can be generated.
